inlineImageAndParagraph.heading: What is Phonetic Name Matching?
content: In the diverse landscape of global identity verification, spelling variations can lead to significant false negatives. Decentro's Phonetic Name Matching API, part of our Farsight Data Forensics suite, solves this by comparing names based on how they sound rather than just how they are spelled.

Traditional string matching fails when encountering typos, phonetic variations (e.g., 'C' vs 'K'), or transliteration differences common in multi-lingual regions like India. Our API leverages advanced phonetic algorithms to determine the likelihood that two distinct text strings represent the same individual, enhancing the reliability of your KYC and onboarding processes.

items.title: Input Ingestion
items.description: Submit two name strings via the `/v2/kyc/match` endpoint (e.g., Input Name and Database Name).

items.title: Phonetic Analysis
items.description: The engine normalizes the text and applies phonetic algorithms to decompose names into their sound components.

items.title: Confidence Scoring
items.description: The API returns a match percentage indicating the probability that the two names belong to the same entity.
